text: Pours light amber with abundant and foamy head. Refuses to come down, quite luscious. Aroma hoppy, not only grass and herbal notes but also something really dank and slightly funky. Getting lots of hop oils, almost hop extract levels. Taste reveals also light and well hopped body, nice bitterness that is dominating but in a nice and enjoyable way. Malty body is still somewhat recognisable but giving way to hops that jump forward and define this beer. Overall, nice and drinkable, I would say feels more like an IPA than an amber.

440ml can. Pours a deep caramel colour with a little head. Lots of sweet toffee, some orange peel, some pepper, maybe a touch of lemon in the finish. Sweet, bitter, and, admittedly, pretty dank. Very nice.

16 oz single can from Total Wine & More - Laguna Hills. Amber and pretty clear in appearance with a white head. Aroma of mild citrus fruit, bread, caramel malt, toffee, pine and light grassy/floral notes. Similar flavor, adding moderate malt sweetness and mild hop bitterness. Medium body with a balanced finish. Solid amber ale overall, but nothing special.

30/V/17 - 1Pt. can @ home - BB: n/a, canned: XII/8/16 (2017-688) Thanks to Ster and Trevor for sharing the can!
Clear orange beer, creamy irregular yellowish head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: pretty dank, sweet, malty, caramel, some tropical fruits. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet malts, lots of caramel, some tropical fruits, but very faint. Aftertaste: alcohol, sweet malts, bit resinous, hoppy touch, some peach. Nice but getting pretty old already...

473ml can. Pours a hazy copper-amber with a large, frothy, long lasting, white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, orange, grapefruit, tropical fruit, peach and pine. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, biscuit, peach, apricot, tropical fruit, orange peel, tangerine and pine resin with a dry, bitter grass finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Awesome, by far the hoppiest amber I have ever tried. A world class amber.

Pint on tap at Beer Revolution in Edmonton (Modern Times Tap Takeover) pours a pale amber color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus and pine with some caramel. Taste is a citrus and pine hop bitterness with a caramel malty sweetness. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, a nicely crafted brew that is tasty and balanced, but not a dark amber, more of a hybrid IPA.
Can. Copper/amber cloudy. Malt dominates. Sweet, biscuity. In the middle are some juicy, fruity hop flavors. Mango, mandarine. High bitterness.

1 pint can. From the blurb on the can, it appears that this brew is aggressively hopped, like a pale ale or an IPA, over a amber ale malt base. Appearance-wise, this amber ale pours an almost-clear deep amber shade, with a good head of froth, which manages to persist for a while before receding a a thin ring. Aroma-wise, hops are forward and everywhere! Floral and citrus notes dominate, but more of the pine and resin in particular, with almost undetectable doughy, biscuity malt notes. Taste-wise, again it is dank, following the hops, mainly piney, grassy and resin flavours with a little but of fruitiness, above a light wheat malt backbone, and a bitter finish. Palate-wise, it has a nice, average level of carbonation, a somewhat medium-to-light body. Somehow, the focus on the hops makes the amber ale character less prominent, as does the lightening of the malt base, so it does not feel quite like a weightier amber ale.
Can at the Fountain and Ink in London. Really big hops for an amber, balanced with a little malt and some summer fruits. Long bitter finish. Really good beer.

Appearance: clear medium amber with one finger of rocky ivory head, excellent retention and well-defined lacing. (5/5) Aroma: dank resin, white wine, citrus, pale and caramel malt, tropical fruit. (9/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate-high bitter. (9/10) Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry bitter finish. (4/5)

With Nelson Sauvin and Mosaic hops, this combines two of my favourite hops. On the other hand, the combination of dank sticky icky and white wine seems like a bit of a culture clash - or, at least, not the kind of parties I get invited to. Shut up! I get invited to parties! Ill have you know, the last party I went to, we partied like it was 1999! ...because it was... My social graces - or lack thereof - aside, this might well be the best Amber Ive ever had - because its not really an Amber, its a DIPA in all but name. Big bombastic fun, well into legendary status. (18/20)

9/10 #ryansbooze ryansbooze.com

1 pint can. Hazy amber colour, suspended yeast flecks, white head on top which is creamy and messy. Big hoppy nose, dank, pine and orange peels. Flavour - hop dominant with lemon, orange and pine, malts in background are toasty and sweet. Finish is pine/dank/orange peel, big bitterness. Super hoppy amber, this is great.

One year old can!
Aroma is more malty sweetness with some faint hop aroma(herbal)
The body is Amber clear (really!) 1 finger white head nice lacing.
Taste is sweet upfront followed by some light bitterness.
Palate is medium low body with medium carbonation.

Overall pretty impressive for the age. Hope I can find this one again fresh in Spain!

Citus and quite a lot of resin like an old hash pipe. A little metal acrylic type aroma on the nose. Pours amber with ok head. Overrated. Bitter finish, with some tang from malt. Tap at Meridian Pint.

Can at Proletariat. Pours a softly hazed amber with a thin white head. Gentle malt on the nose, a bit of citrus. Medium bodied, soft bitterness, a bit of earthy pine. Musk, slow bitterness, a touch of pith, light earthy finish.
Can. Bronze with a medium head. Complex hoppiness dominates.Lots of fruitiness and overflowing with flavour. A good one and my first from this brewery.

From a can into a tulip glass. Pours cloudy amber copper with head and lace. Aroma of amber malts, straw hops, hay, wet towel. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of fresh grains, straw hops, minerals, celery extract, dry bamboo, oak, wet towel. Overall rich, complex, so so...not something Id want another round.

473ml can. Barely clear, amber colour with average, frothy to creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, off-white head. Grassy, piney and tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, zesty notes of orange, some gooseberry, a touch of peppermint. Taste is dry, minimally nuttily malty, hints of peanut pellicle, bitter hoppy overtones with hints of gooseberry and peppermint, a minimally soapy touch. Creamy texture, lively, prickling carbonation.

Amber body with a nice. off-white frothy cream cover. Dank green hop nose joined by musky grapefruit and a touch of cattiness. Body strikes similar chords, quite dank, musky summer night heaviness with a robust, dank herb character that hangs on the palate.

16 ounce can. Pours a clear amber orange color with a small white head. A big citrus and caramel nose, dank. Rich fruity hop flavor, very dank, floral, huge citrus. This is really a somewhat malty IPA and a damn good one at that. 6.8% is just perfect for this. I could drink a ton of this. The kind of beer that you can easily drink a few sips of and not notice because it is so smooth and not a 17% BA Impy. Say at a tasting. Needs a glass or three to be appreciated. Lovely.
Beautiful copper with a white head. Aroma is mostly pine resin. Not as aggressively hoppy as advertised, but enough to make it stand out against common Amber Ales. Bracing and delicious.

Can in Seattle. Tall chunky foam, amber-malty gold. Dank, heavy hop nose. Sweet, heavy orange juice. Medium weight, an incredibly, tasty hopped amber. Somewhat a Vienna-style pale ale. A bit of creamier cocoa in malt, banana bread, moderately sweet. Intriguing.

On tap at Lardo. Colour...clear amber with a thick head. Nose...much hoppier than I expected for an amber! Hints of malt but the hops overpower the malt. Palate...full, round and frothy with big piney hops and field dust. Pit fruits hit the mid palate and the hoppy bitterness continues through the demi-sec finish.

Fat på Saliga Munken i Norrköping. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, övermogna päron, konserverade persikor med toner av grapefrukt och citrus. Stor sötma, rund och len, fruktig, frisk, fin balans och beska. Toppen!
Amber brown color, tan head. Ripe fruit nose, caramel, malty, hints of pineapple and mango. Grapefruit taste, malty, ripe fruit, moderate bitterness. A bit old. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Tasted on 2/26/17 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Jamie. Pours hazy muted amber with a thick white beige head that slowly recedes to thick, uneven lace. The nose is bright grassy resin hops with some dark basement notes, and plenty of spicy bread malt. The flavor is even more spicy bread malt, with the bitter resin, grass, and grapefruit peel secondary. The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long bitter grapefruit peel and pine resin finish.

Can, 473ml from Clink Beer & Bar, Birmingham Digbeth. Hazed amber with white head. There is a slight metallic note to this initially which subsides towards a caramel, resinous character. Some fruity sweetness along with the toffee note, tropical, mango. Reasonable depth of flavour. Its fine.

Can from Rickfifty. Thanks! Pours amber, with a frothy, white head. Citrus and malt, some old pineapple and grapefruit. Tiny alcohol sting. Caramel, some pine and cellar. Medium to thick body. A bit oily. Soft carbonation. A bit too old I think. The swedish importer has labeled it best before june 2017, but they are known for exaggerating best before dates on hoppy beers...
On tap in Encinitas. Pours dark amber red. Fruity hops balanced (perhaps too much) by a strong malty backbone. Really nice amber, wish the hop flavours would have shone through even more!

Can.

A- Dank, hoppy, caramel, slightly floral.

A- Amber color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Bitter, dank, grassy, caramel, bready.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- Normally I wouldnt like stuff like this but it was so well done it was hard not to like it. Definitely a bitter and fairly aggressive amber. Not your typical one. Lots of earthy and citrusy hops.
How: can Appearance: clear deep orange, medium white head. Aroma: pine, caramel, citrus, pineapple, pears, grass. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation.

(Can) Clear copper body with a big, frothy cream head; some thick lace. Flowery hop aroma; grapefruit, peach, resin, straw. Full body; soft carbonation; chewy. Flavor is medium sweet with lots of piney hop bitterness; caramel, orange; slightly herbal; bitter finish.

Bottle from The Bottle Shop London and drunk at home. Slight haze amber colour. White head. Some dankness on the aroma. Some dank hops. Some good malty flavour. Some bitterness on the finish. Good hops, good malts, good balance. Likeable enough. but simple
Burk. Klar mörkorange med ett snyggt smutsvitt skum. Dofter av malt, karamell och gran. Smakinslag av desamma samt citrus. Halvtorr munkänsla, medelbeska.

Keg Two-Thirds of a Pint at BrewDog, Shepherds Bush, London in April 2016 - Hazy Amber in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Very Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Fruity; orange citrus and tropical fruit. Malty; toasty grainy malts, caramel. Spicy. Moderately bitter piney hoppy fruity and grainy malty throughout. Quite dry. Very drinkable. Terrific Amber Ale! (2016-04-05)

Clear, copper colored, medium- off white frothy head. Aroma is of malt, some biscuit and caramel, moderate fruity, tropical and citrus hops. Taste is medium sweet malt, biscuit, caramel, lightly toasted bread, medium fruity and citrus, some tangerine, bit floral, medium bitterness, sweet fruit but a dry and bitter finish and aftertaste. Medium bodied, average carbonation, oily. Not the freshest can, but still pretty hoppy.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with caramel and notes of pine. Dry finish
Shared can at Bjørnøy. Pours clear deep golden with a tiny head. Aroma is resiny hops, tropical fruits. Taste is crisp, moderate dry with a good malty backbone, very good and moreish.

Fra boks på romjulstreff i RBHD des-16: klar gylden med flott skum som varer. Nydelig humleprofil i aroma og smak, her finner jeg granskudd, aprikos, karamell og sukat i tillegg til de obligatoriske tropiske frukter. Her finner vi roen alle sammen. Delikat, saftig og lett bitterhet i ettersmaken - de 85 IBU er fascinerende godt skjul.

Shared bottle at RB/HD at Bjørnøy 29.12.16. Clear dark golden. Quickly diminishing white head. Aroma old tropical fruits, dried citrus zest and sawdust, perhaps also with a hint of sap and liquorise. Similar taste, with round mouthfeel.
Shared 1 US pint can at local tasting. Deep golden colour, white head. Aroma of pine / resin and sprucetips. Dry flavour, notes of resin and pine needles.
Can:Pours hazy amber with a large head. Hoppy aroma with lots pine and some cookie dough and red berries. Big, hoppy flavour with loads of resinous pine. Big and long bitterness.

Aroma is hop forward resiny, citrus pineapple. Sweet malt present but mainly hop. Appearance is light hazed copper with frothy off white head that retains well. Taste is similar to the aroma, resiny pineapple citrus. Caramel malt and hop bitterness well balanced. Palate is medium. A bit watery for being a larger beer although it hides its alcohol well. Some creaminess hanging out. Overall a decent Amber IPA. Lacks any malt depth and there really isnt anything unique with the hopping. Overpriced for what it is.
On tap. Pours a clear copper wiylth moderate head. Aromas of wet malts, grass and copper. Dry bitter flavors of same with additional dry oranges.

Estamos ante sin duda una de las mejores amber, para mi la mejor que he probado, su aroma (lupulo) ya prevee lo que viene después, explosion de sabores a lupulo, tropicales, perfectamente balanceado con maltas ligeramente tostadas, modern times, no hay dudas, clava una tras otra, y en este caso incluso puede adornarse, ESPECTACULAR

Theres an album by Swans called The Burning World. Generally, their fans - and the band - consider it to be their worst release. However, there is one brilliant single from The Burning World, "God Damn the Sun." In typical Swans fashion, the song tells a violent, depressing story to the tune of lovely, melancholy strings. It makes you wonder at how something so unforgiving can be so beautiful. Blazing World sort of offers a similar experience. Its a an attractive deep red ale with cream-colored suds. Almost none of that lovely amber malt is detectable in the aroma - its nearly all earthy dank hops. Flavor profile is quite similar. Theres some caramel and chocolate malt, but mostly theres piney, resinous, and citrusy hops. There is some typical Amber Ale richness, but the hop bitterness is certainly apparent.
Half pint, keg, ushers. Pours almond Amber with a thin white head. Scent is Amber ale. Taste is fantastic hoppy Amber ale with gorgeous hints of rosemary. Finish is dry and sweet. Fantastic.
Pours gold into a pint. Tan head with little retention recedes to nothing. Resin and grapefruit aromas. Sweet caramel and resin upfront turning to dank weed and grapefruit in the lasting finish.
Can. Slightly hazy amber body with a medium head. Caramel, fudge, tons of hops, some fudge, pineapple. Nice attitude in this one.

Stor burk från SB. Bärnstensfärgad, disig med medelhögt krämigt skum. En Imperial red som är massivt humlad och ångar humle, tallfenoler, såpa och bensin. Smaken är mer sansad men beska är tydlig och dominerar smakbilden med kåda, grapevita och resin. Kroppen finns där och bär smaker och håller ihop det hela men når inte fram med några smaker. Välbalanserad sötma. Maffigt och helt okej utan att glänsa.

Dimmig-grumlig, brunaktig bärnstens färgad, orange-khaki skum. Doft: Humle finns tydligt men ändå tillbakadragen, mörk kola, skog, lite choklad, humle, mammas bröd. Smak: Mörk fruktkola, lite kakao, fruktsallad, fruktgodis med lite lakrits, Cola.

Clear copper body with a minimal wispy beige head. The nose is juicy tropical hops with a light underlying toasty malt base. The flavor is hop forward for sure, juicy and bright with light bitterness up front, fades to a slightly more toasted malt and caramel finish. Lighter bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Pretty enjoyable for an amber, but this isnt the everyday brewpub amber, lots more hops in this guy.
Burk från SB. Bärnstensfärgad kulör med fällning och orangevitt skum. Doft av knäck, rostad malt och ananas. Halvsöt kropp med mediumstor efterbeska. Smak av knäck, tall och ananas. Mkt rena smaker.
Can from Janes Beer Store, Mountain View. Fruity and resin aroma with some malt hints. Some interesting flavours in there. Fruit resin pine, caramel, bitter. Pretty tasty.

Burk från SB. Lätt grumlig mörkorange med vitbeiget skum. Rågig, ganska stickande beska som växer till sig. Mycket granskott, honung, resin, brödiga toner, grape, apelsinskal, gräsig. Blir bättre en bit in. Bra! Vill säga mer IPA än Amber överlag.

Light coffee, grapefruit, pine, grainy, 
Amber/Brown colour, big creamy off-white head, good amount lacing.
Lightly salty, mid-sweet, medium bite, coffee, grapefruit.
Medium body, bit sharp carbonation, bitter finish.
As always a well crafted brew from Modern times.

Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours beautifully clear Amber with a thick foamy white head. Aroma of fresh pine,tangerine,pinapple,grapefruit backed by caramel & biscuit. Taste is predominantly malty with more biscuit ,toast,bread & caramel with good hops giving tangerine,pine & grapefruit & a hint of passionfruit . Smooth medium bodied with nice bitterness & dryness,the finish is hop fruity with more citrus,pine ,grapefruit ,pepper & Bready biscuity malt with caramel. Not a classic Amber ale but very well made but it is what it says on the can a hoppy dank Amber ale . Fantastic!

Can from Trader Joes. Amber pour with a huge off white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, dank hops, spicy hops, and toasted malt. Flavor is malty, slightly bitter, and fruity. Mouthfeel is pretty smooth. Level of carbonation is medium low.
Can from SB. Cloudy orange with a medium off white head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, caramel and hops. Medium body with a long bitter / fruity finish.

2 finger white head, great lacing. 
Clear amber coloured beer. 
Aroma is juicy tropical fruits at first along with that sweet caramel and sour berry aroma that I often get from an amber. Hoppy and piney. 
Taste is... confusing. It definitely tastes good but Im really having a hard time pinpointing flavours. Its not divided like many beers are, the flavours come in one big bubble instead of in separate lanes. 
Grapefruit peel, grapefruit and a solid malt base (roasted malt hint at the back?) which makes it a pretty big beer but still very easily drinkable. 
Reminds me of old school english IPAs but with a less sweet maltiness. 
Good stickiness on the palate. 
Overall, Im not a fan of amber ales but this is a really good one and a goal for the style.

1 pint can at home from FirmaBier. Nose is fruity malty. Body is clear amber, head is small, white, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is caramel, dark berries, honey, milk chocolate, roasted malt. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy a slight roasty medium bitter. Medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, rich aroma, very tasty, perfect balance, great one.
Can at home. Nice, round mouthfeel. Good balance. Grapefruit, hints of cane sugar, black tea and grass.

@ Agards väg 26/11-16. Can from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy with citrus and grapefruit, also pine needles and caramel. Body is medium, the finish is bitter and hoppy with pine needles and caramel.

@ Havregatan 20161125. Can (473 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, hoppy and caramely, citrusy, grapefruits and pine needles, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter, hoppy and sweet.
Orange color, small white head. Aromas of fruit, cinnamon bun dough, malt spices and hops. Taste of cinnamon, citrus, spices and bitter hops that linger during the finish.
473ml Can - Dark amber in colour. Toffee, pine and grapefruit in the aroma. Hoppy, fruity and sweet taste with caramel, grapefruit, pine and raisins.

473ml can from BrewDog. Hazy golden amber colour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma: hops, tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, pine. Taste: fruity, tropical fruit, citrus, slightly vinous, bready malt, piney resin. Dry and bitter, medium bodied. If this is an amber ale its the best Ive had so far, bit different to others in that its really hoppy and IPA-like, but I like that.

1 pint can. 
Pours hazy amber with white head. 
Aroma caramel, pine, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit. 
Taste Caramel sweets, citrus bitter. 
Mouth-feel thin, dry. 
Great brew.

Pours a clear light amber, with a short lived frothy head. Nose is (as it says on the tin) dank hoppy and green. I cant smell the malt. The taste is more complex: bitter dank hops, plus tropical notes, plus a subtle malt note (quite dry), and a faint saline note. Palate is rather light after the taste, but very clean and refreshing. An excellent borderline DIPA.

An Amber done right. Not a weak and thin Amber at all. Slight caramel sweetness with subtle toast. Dank hops show up as promised with tart citrus, complex berry, tropical, melon character from the mosaic hops and a dry pine finish.

Can from Brewdog online. Warm gold colour rather than strongly amber. Mildly characterful malts, not too sweet or crystally which is good. Very interesting tropical fruit character, bitter finish. Really enjoyed the mix of hops in this one, and melded well with the malts. Good stuff.

16oz can pours a clear amber with some soapy, white head. Nose has a clear caramel and grist character, zippy pine, orange, soap. Flavor has some black tea, biscuit, pine, some butterscotch, caramel, mild black pepper, a little herbs and fresh cream. Bitter and dry finish. Very drinkable.
16 oz can pours Amber with a white head. First time I have had a hoppy Amber, not bad.

On tap at the Brewers Fork. Clear golden pour with a white head. Loads of grapefruit. Must have a huge caramel malt bill as the bitterness from the hops is really mellowed out. Average body and mouthfeel. Its a bit muddled but all in all not a bad effort.
Pours a clear light bronze. A sweet malt and citrus hop aroma. A strong citrus hop, sweet malt, caramel, and pine. A lingering bitter hop and sweet malt aftertaste.

16oz can. Crystal clear amber body topped by medium off-white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, dank, some spicy, grapefruit, light grape. Taste is moderately sweet, dank, grape/grapefruit, some spicy, light orange, faint bread. Medium body, light acidity, resin, very drinkable.

Pours a clear amber/copper with a small frothy head. Lovely aroma of pine, citrus hops and malts. The flavour brings through a little caramel in the malts and has some sweetness to it. Really enjoyed this and need to find another one soon.

Can from De Caigny, BB Dec 2016, shared with Benzai, medium sample. Almost clear amber color, short frothy head. Aroma of grapefruit and line, some caramel malts, slight biscuit. Slight malty sweetness in taste, medium bitterness. Not superfresh, but still very tasty.

I love an overly hopped amber or red and this is precisely that - bordering on an IPA alright. A big fruity punch in the nose from the hops - pineapple, peach, passion fruit - lots of sweetness. The amber characteristics are largely in the background - some bready, spicy notes with a little caramel.

1 US pint tallcan. Clear copper, lasting creamy tan foam. Pungent forest fruity hop aroma. Moist forest fruity citric hop taste, semi-sweet leaner pale malts. Average carbonation, light-medium bodied, aggressively hopped for an amber, could pass for an IPA. Very good. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

Can @ home shared by Caesar. Clear golden to light amber color, average sized off-white head that diminishes fairly quickly. Aroma is malts, dank sticky hops. Taste malts, a slight hint of caramel, hops, dank sticky hops, nicely bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Nice!
16oz can from CBC, dated 08/15/16. Pours golden brown with an off white head. Aroma is dank, pine. Flavor is mild caramel, grapefruit, dank, pine. Nice.

De la micro cervecera Modern Times esta American Red Ale o tambien se conoce el estilo como American Amber Ale de nombre Blazing World, los envases de esta cervecería suelen ser muy detallados, este no es la excepción, marca el contenido de alcohol por volumen(ABV) 6.8%, nivel de amargor(IBUs) 85, los lúpulos empleados; Nelson, Simcoe y Mosaic, las maltas tambien son especificadas; Two Row, Múnich y Midnigth Wheat, incluso viene la gravedad final, esta receta de la cervecería de San Diego goza de muy buena calificación en la pagina especializada en cerveza Ratebeer, con calificación en estilo de 100/100 y en el general 97/100, manteniendo la buena calidad siempre en sus productos, creémonos un criterio propio.
http://www.ratebeer.com/beer/modern-times apariencia de esta cerveza es llamativa con una corona de espuma amplia y blanquecina, de perlas compactas y medias que aparentan porosidad, buena retención en la vida de la cerveza, la tonalidad del liquido es un ámbar intenso con destellos rojizos, turbiedad presente que puede ser por dos razones, que la cerveza no este filtrada o por el dry hopping, el las paredes del vaso se avecina un cuerpo mediano, ligera actividad de carbonatación.
Los aromas son potentes y destacan de primera instancia el lúpulo, las típicas características americanas se liberan como toronja, piña, durazno y mango, hay presencia de dulzor como caramelo, las maltas apenas se perciben dando ligero toque a pan.
El sabor realmente esta perfecto en cuanto el standar, aunque es una cerveza con 85 unidades de amargor esta bien cimentada, la base de las maltas aportando dulzor necesario para equilibrar, los lúpulos dan características frutales y cítricas, puedo identificar toronja, mango, durazno, piña, toronja, cascara de naranja, muy tropical para una cerveza ambarina, la malta aporta toques a caramelo y corteza de pan o galletas, sabor interesante y concentrado pero bien balanceado, ligero picor al final del trago y amargor consistente que la vuelven seca, me gusto bastante en general en vista, aroma y sabor se plantea solida.

Four pack of cans from the brewery. Pours out a clear light amber. Frothy off white head sticks around a long time. Fine bubbly carbonation. Earthy-pine-citrus aromas. Flavor starts with a decent slap of roasty malts, followed by layers of hop flavor and bitterness. Earthy pine, spice and fruity white wine. Soft texture and very easy drinking. Long bittersweet finish.
Draft. Pours amber with an off white head. Dank oily hops, spruce, lighter citrus, some sweeter malty notes, mild-moderate bitterness, and a balanced finish. Quite drinkable.

Appearance: Deeper copper pour. Slightly hazy. Half a finger of white foam.
Nose: primarily floral hops and caramelized malt with some aspects of spice, herbs and earth as well
Taste: Decent herbal & floral hop bite up front. Decent bitters. Medium sweetness. Caramel and earth. Good bitter hop finish. 
Body: Medium and malty
Parting thoughts: Quite a surprise. I had low expectations for this beer. also because I confused the brewer with another brewer entirely.

Can, bought @Mikkeller Webshop. Pours clear amber with a small, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has sweet malts, a very light toffee note to it, firm resin and grapefruity hops. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, quite fat like you get in a Barley Wine, mildly toasted, light oats feel to it. Very well balanced bitterness, the citrus subdued, the resin more prominent. Very bitter finish, but nothing that ever sticks out in a negative way. A really solid brew, instantly drinkable, yet never compromising.

I don't have the depth of knowledge to provide a professionally sounding critique - but as you won't allow me to rate a beer along the simple scale without resorting to an additional potentially pithy and poncy sounding review, here you are: "It tastes like something I'll want to drink again."

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, 1 pint. A dark amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is of floral hops, spices and maybe some firewood. Taste is medium bitter with an aftertaste of spices. Medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Goes bitter at the end with some herbs.

Can, 1 pint. Clear amber with a creamy tan head. Aromas of caramel, floral hops, spices, light fruity notes. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Rich roasted character into a smooth hoppy finish.

caramel, floral, woody, vanilla, amber, orange, brown, hazy, tan foam, frothy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, medium body, slick feel, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, long finish.
Fuity flavours with a woody nose. Reminds me a lot of California summer. Great taste with long palate and a fully party for the end. One of the best in my list.
Draft at Churchkey. Clear deep golden color. Nice earthy fruity vinous aroma. Taste is bitter and floral. Not like any amber Ive had. Tasty.

Can from San Diego / California / USA. Canned on July 18 2016. Golden copper color. Soapy thick head, kept a good lace. Fantastic aroma of malt, pine, hops and marginal smoked meat or something burned in a positive way like when you light a match and you love the smell. The taste starts with a hop and malt kick, bitter fruits, dry hoppy finish. Very very tasty.

Modern Times has done a nice job with
this one. Well rounded, sticky yes, dank yes, slight bitterness in the backend. Im drinking this from a can so the appearance is based on the can. The can looks fine. 
The malt is subdued, complimentary to the forefront of the hops. I find that even with the big mouth can, the aroma fades away after a time.

Draught at Öltappen Motala
Very sweet aroma with red berries. 
Too sweet in flavour, sugary. Red berries and fruity toffee. 
Medium bitterness.
Draft at the source on 7/1/2016. Clear golden color with a white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is citrus, pine, caramel, and malt. Almost more like an IPA. Good.

From tap pours light hazy with rather small head. Nose is hoppy and rich with citric tones. Taste is light oily with lots of hops and citrus as well. Also a very fresh light bitter taste and palate. Longlasting hops at the end. Very nice and drinkable.

Can into mug. Aromas of exploding grapefruits and oranges with slight piney bitterness. Pours copper clear with thick head. Multidimensional taste, citrus and dank comes in with firm but smooth bitterness followed by layers of sweet malt and burnt caramel. Very delicious.

Tall can from Bottle Jockey in Burnaby. A dark amber beer with whitish medium head and faintly citrus nose. Bitter citrus hop with ample malt background. Well balanced, but the body is too heavy to be my favorite summer beer. 3.6

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2016 Pours orange from the can, light for an "amber" (though Id call it a malty IPA). Aroma is mild, some citrus. Taste is great, a dank wallop of bitter hops, citrus pith, pine, with medium bready sweetness. Reminds me a bit of Dogfish 90 min. Very good.

Pours hazy dark blonde with medium white head. Nose is fruity and resin. Aromas are toasted malts, fruity, resinous pine.low carbonation, medium body. Medium bitter and resinous finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from the tap at Beer Geek Taipei. Medium light orange with off white head. Tropical hops, mild citrus hops and bread malt, good balance.
Fresh can. Deep copper with lots of lacing. Nose of dank hops. Taste is bitter with grapefruit pith, bready malts, sticky pine.

16oz can from IG trade. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a thick frothy off white head of foam. Aroma of caramel, toast, grass, old citrus, tangerine and peach skins. Taste mimics the nose, but citrus is comes through more fresh and juicy. Not big on ambers but this is tasty! And canned 03/23/16 so more then 3 months old. Sure it would have been killer fresh.

Taps clear amber with a thick and fine-bubbled eggshell head. Aroma presents resiny hops, evergreen and fresh malt. Flavor delivers evergreen, hoppy, woody, and malty notes for a very drinkable and enjoyable ale. Body is good, fizz is lively. Form Blazing Ale - put those spinning laser blades together!

Can 47,5cl.
@ 32GreatPower, Seville, Spain.
A: Amber.
T: Hops, resinous, malty.
Nice Amber color and head. Deep aromatic piney, citrusy sniffs when poured. Great fruity yet balanced pine flavors. Easy drinking beer! Thumbs up!

Draught at BierCraft Wesbrook, VancouverLight amber color, hazy, with creamy head. Mild aroma of hops, but the hops are much more expressive in the flavor, where they blend with crispy and biscuity malts, and wisely the body is lean and mouthfeel quite dry. A bit bready.Very good.
Beer Culture, 5/12/16. Amber pour. Nice hop aroma, floral, grassy, and pine notes. Flavor is on the bitter side, similar to the side and a bit of citrus too. Drinks nicely. Good mouthfeel.

aroma lets you know whats going on... grassy wheat hits you like a ton of bricks. Growled down with citrusy hops, but a lot of non aroma, however, Nicely polished life a couple of pearls-- finishing off nicely
Pint can from systembolaget bs. Pours amber with little head. Sweet fruity roasted aroma with sweet caramel citrus taste.
Can. Pours mostly clear deep golden with a frothy off white head. The aroma is malty and fruity with berry notes. Citrus fruity hoppy with stone fruit and biscuit malty notes. Solid.

On tap at BierCraft UBC, pours a clear copper with a small white head. Aroma brings out piney hops, light bready notes and crackery malt. Flavour is intense for an amber, with resinous and piney hops upfront, followed by bready malt. Exceedingly hoppy for an amber. Excellent.
Draft - Nice light Skunky notes. Clear gold with a decent white head. Nice Skunky weedy notes. Nice.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 On tap at BierCraft with Jamey and Brad. Pours clear gold (not amber) with a white head. Aroma is just hops (where is caramel?). Taste is just hoppy with some earthy notes. Piney bitterness aftertaste. Good one, but not as amber beer.
Poured from can. Amber in colour. Small lacy head. Nice taste in the palate cotrus and malt throughout. Deliciously hoppy
On tap the beer has an amber color in the glass with a nice head. Aroma of malts, resin and some caramel. Taste has more malts with some caramel and toast. Carbonated beer with a medium finish.

Bue en canette de 50cl à la maison,
Couleur ambrée avec reflet blond, petite mousse et effervescence moyenne.
Nez assez complexe sur les houblons avec de lananas le fruit de la passion et les agrumes.
En bouche grosse attaque ananas, puis sur le citron vert assez piquante en bouche, elle se termine sur une pointe caramélisée, juste exquise

Look: amber, cloudy.

Aroma: currant leaves, dusty grass, bergamot, grape.
Taste: bitter-sweet.
Flavour: toffee, caramel, zesty hops, spicy herbs.

Good beer.

Tropical fruits, ripe mango and passion fruit, lemon milkshake. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Topical fruits again, mango, passion fruit, soft bitterness is coming up, citrus fruits, grapefruit. Superbly amazing Amber Ale, aroma and palate like a nice IPA. Keg at BrewDog, Cardiff.

Oh yeah. I love these guys. Pint at BD Camden. Pours muddy brown. Subtle aroma of malt. Very subtle: wasnt sure what to expect from that. But on the taste its a big explosion of hops, bitterness, malt, almost smoky. Its like an eighty shilling which has been pimped to the max. Stands and applauds.
Pours slightly cloudy amber. Aroma is hoppy, malt balancing. Taste is hoppy, with a nice slightly roasted balance.

Keg at BD Camden. It pours a clean golden color with s small white head. Aroma is tangy crispy full of grassy citric fruity hops with light danky notes, apricots and pine cones. Taste is lightly sweet and fruity upfront and then turns again tangy hoppy with more pine cones and tsngerine. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, flavourful

Robe ambrée, limpide, bonne pétillance, mousse blanche moyenne. Nez de houblons résineux, mandarine, orange. En bouche, les houblons résineux (simcoe?) dominent, belle notes de résine et pin, les agrumes sont également présents (orange sanguine, pamplemousse), base maltée légèrement présente. Lamertume est bien prononcée, le corps est bien rond, carbo bien réussie et très bonne longueur. Excellente bière, au houblonnage très généreux.

Can at home, I believe this recent Modern Times surge is temporary so get while the getting is good. Amber pour small sudsy head. Nose is fruity and herbal. Tastes of caramel, candied fruit, herbal, bready, some grass, pineapple and light cheesy tones. Finishes sweet. Medium bodied and fair bitterness.

Can to tulip. Amber with a slight haze and an off white head. Nose reeks of damp dank hop. Palate runs the gamut. Deep woodsy hop, some grapefruit in there, resin syrupy, really well balanced against a dry cracker malt. Finish is crispy and clean. Prefect for a Friday night session.

A reddish beer, a head is blond and medium. Aroma has grapefruits, some other fruitness, mild caramel. Taste is strongly bitter, herbs, some citrusfruits, very low caramel. Medium bodied. More fruitness would be nice, but also the can is quite old. The sweetness is greatly balanced and not too sweet, more like the taste is dry.
Aroma is dank hops, spices, pine and a background of citrus. The flavor is grapefruit, citrus, mildly syrupy body, malts and a mix of bitter/hoppy and slightly sweet in the finish.
can at home. Pours clear dark golden, not really amber. Low to no head. Cheesy hops in the nose, Bitter body, IPA overly bitter. Thin mouthfeel, metallic bitter taste. Burning finish.
50cl can. Clear dark amber with a modest white head. Pine, grapefruit and caramel, and a silky smoot texture with low carbonation. Very nice.

T Ran and Dales. Thanks Melody! Hazy amber with a white head. Fresh hoppy aroma, some apricot, a little bit of melon. Bitter and dry with a little bit of onion peel. Medium-to-full body, bitter and fresh leafy hoppy finish.
Can at tasting. Copper color. Aroma of pine hop, caramel, malt and mild fruit. Taste has bitter pine, caramelised malt, fresh hops and some bitters. Cant taste the Nelson or Mosaic unfortunately.

En bärnstensfärgad öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Denna gillar jag verkligen, riktigt bra humlad men ändå med en bra och lagom kraftig maltkropp. Frukt, citrus, sötma, karamell och en lagom beska. Riktigt trevlig!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
can-no label - pours gold white head - nose/taste of pine, toffee, citrus, bread malt and caramel - medium body
Can. Orange pour with white head. Herbal grassy aromas. Light malty, herbal, grassy hop Flavors.

Cans from multiple trades from misterburd -- cheers! This is a great idea beautifully come to life. The guys at Modern Times dreamed up a sticky, dank, hoppy amber beer and this beer is the (great) result. Its aggressively dank, and the amber malt base (which Ive seen sink a lot of otherwise great IPAs) actually boosts everything here, making it even stickier and accentuating the dankness. Fantastic beer, and a worthy choice for my #420 review.

Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh, Friday 18th March 2016 in the company of Dad and Barry.  Pours amber there is a very slight haze. This is bloody good, hoppy but with a good malty underbelly. This is bloody lovely beer, juicy fruits, late stinging bitterness, really good punch citrus and piney resin, thick substantial mouthfeel, little bit of oomph...  A6 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 4.0

Can. Pours golden with off white head. Aroma is malty citrus and piney. taste is sweet malty and piney with a piney finish. Kinds of reminds me of a candy i had when i was little called horehound. Pretty good.
Can shared. Peach mango tropical fruit nose. Sweet caramel flavour with Slightly bitter finish. Good balance. Lovely.

Can sample at a tasting at Beer&Beyond shop. Pours clear orange-copper with a nice head. Aroma of hops with notes grapefruit, citrus, onion, garlic and green leaves. Flavor is moderately sweet, fruity, cheesy, onion, with green hops and nice crispy bitterness, very dry finish. Medium-bodied, smooth and fresh. Very good.
50cl can from saveur-biere. Clear copper color. Medium bitterness. Low sweetness. Dry finish. Aroma is grassy, malty, hoppy.

Can taken away from BrewDog Leicester, drunk at home. Dark gold/orange more than amber, massively carbonated with a big white head. Resin predominant in the aroma with some bready yeast and a hint of tropical fruit. Tastes quite bitter, the hop bitterness overpowering the sweet German malt. Long dry aftertaste. Body surprisingly thin. Very good but Top 50? Hmmm.

Slightly hazy amber color with off-white head. Aroma is fruity and herbal, quite dank with some caramel malt in the background. Taste starts really fruity, just a bit sweet, nice and balanced. Finishes bitter with grapefruit pith and lingers also in the aftertaste. Body and carbonation are medium. Really nice, classic amber ale. Tasty and easy to drink.

Can sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. Clear golden with off-white head. Fresh aroma of onion, grapefruit and tropical fruits. The flavor has nice hoppy bitterness, notes of tropical fruits and some herbal tea, dry. Light to medium-bodied. Fresh and refreshing.
keg at brewdog brumopaque dark amber, beige lacing, lots of red berry and mango on nose, full bodied, bracing bitterness, lots of tropical fruit and piney hops, long red berry pithy hops in finish

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham, with Jezza. Marvellous beer - everything good in the modern {honk} craft beer experience. Powerful with hop, thick\redolent with jazzy orangey jungly taste. Bouncing fruit. Jammy, jammy taste - sweet with tang and cut. Bound.

1 pint can brought back across the pond from sunny California by Colin, my thanks to him. An orange/amber coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Hoppy, dank, malty, caramel aroma. Tastes the same, hoppy, malty, dank, caramel, butterscotch, slight sweetness. Interesting and quaffable.

6.8%ABV. Amber Ale.

Tapped out deep gold. 10ºSRM.

Nose is funky lactic aroma.

Mouthfeel is soapy. The front of the palate is round and sour with some pale malt sweet and some lightly toasted malt flavors. 

Finish is brief and one-note. Overall, was a "meh" for me this time. Will certainly come round to this one again in a year or so...and who knows....

Now this is my kinda amber. Im not usually a fan because of they are too sweet. This has a great hop aroma of fruit. Like tropical fruit. The malt flavor still comes through well, but is not the main story, there are supporting hop bitterness. Very good.
Smells of roasted malts. Copper clear beer with ring and thin island of head. Delicious but hoppy for an amber.

The aroma on this is very similar to their hoppy wheat. Lots of mango, passionfruit, and tropical hop character. Theres also a light, dank floral component. The body is a transparent dark golden color, and in no way does this even remotely appear to be amber in color. Medium, off-yellow head. Starts with a bit of a piney and citrus hop flavor. Some grapefruit is also present. The middle of this has some chewy malt sweetness. Finishes with more tropical hop flavor. This is an IPA. Its very similar to Sierra Nevada Tropical IPA, which I have next to it. This is not an amber ale.

Tap @ One Pint Pub, Helsinki. Pours a reddish amber with a good, beige head. Aroma is hoppy with citrus, slight dank, very hoppy. Taste follows along the same lines. Citrus, dank, pine, some caramel. Very nice.

Pours two fingers of head on a clear darker straw body.
The aroma is big tropical fruit paradise. Wonderful.
The taste starts with some moderate pine and lemon bitter, then more malty but not quite sweet middle and end.
The texture is thicker.
Great aroma and good flavor.
Good but expected more given the ratings. Earthy malt background followed by a good hop presence that was resiny and dank. Nice amber color and head; however, too light and wastery.
Poured from a pint sized can. Big American hop aroma, grassy, slightly vegetal. Low malt character, bready, grainy. Great aroma, low complexity.

Can. Thanks, N! What a cool treat. Pours a cloudy dark amber with a dense and creamy off-white head. Bright tangy sweet nose, showing pretty pine and grapefruit and a bit of lemon zest. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Nicely toasted caramel under a steady, pretty wash of pine, grapefruit, and lemon zest on the mid palate. Clean, mild finish.

Draught at the Kerho, Tampere, Finland.
Cloudy golden color with a small white head.
Citrusy and sourish hops, mild bitterness and some fruitiness in the aroma. 
The flavor is citrusy and fruity hops, tropical fruits, mild sourness, mild bitterness and dryish malt. Both drinkability and likability are very high. This goes very well with the System of a Down coming from the bar sound system. Enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Beer Belly LA. Goldish amber, nice frothy head. A: hoppy, pine, lime, light exotic fruit. Nice. T: medium fruity bitter, bitter notes of lemon and pine in development. Bitter notes are less pronounced after yeast is deposited, nice. Light fruity bitter aftertaste. Nothing wrong with this one.

This was a very good beer it was smooth yet hoppy. It was nice all the way through the end. It was the right color and taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Kerho. Pours slightly hazy copper, white head. Hops, caramel, fruits in the aroma. Malts, caramel, pine hops in the flavor. Balanced, nice

Keg at Man in the Moon, Stockholm.  Cloudy amber, small head. Peachy citric nose. Sweet with medium-full body and clean, spritzy mouthfeel. Piney and resinous, overcarbonated with sugar, caramel, apricot and lemon. Peppery bitter finish. Another underwhelming effort by this brewer.

Refrigerated 16 oz. aluminum can, from slowrunner77, poured into an English Pint glass. Clear light Amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is nice herbal hops, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is herbal hops and bitter finish.
On tap @ Sheraton Quinns Alehouse. Light orange Amber, lacy white head. Big ripe tropical fruit aroma and flavour, light caramel malts, long bitter finish. Really fresh and bright. Fantastic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Aroma is caramelly and malty. Floral and slight earthy.
Taste is wet grassy with grapefruit and lemon peals. Mid bitter finish. Pretty good for an amber.

Half pint @ OPP. Lähes kirkas meripihkan oranssinen. Tuoksussa runsaasti trooppista hedelmää, papaijaa, ananasta, sitrusta. Maussa mallasta, mäntyistä, ihanan raikasta humalaa, sitrusta, makeaa hedelmää. Älyttömän hyvää!

16oz can@ trailer. Brilliant copper kettle color with ivory foam. Very nice citrusy, spicy, dank hoppy aromas. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Tangy citrus, spicy hop, tropical fruit, lightly sweet caramel flavors----tangy drying finish___good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Keg (One Pint, Helsinki)
Zesty aroma, some soapiness, lots of citrus. Fullish palate, sweet, and a little cummy, but keggy carbonation. Sweet caramelly malts, citrussy hops. Kinda decent IPA, but I can do without the carbonic acid. Citrus hoppy, but one dimensional and boring.

(Keg at One Pint Pub, 20151219) The beer poured amber and nearly clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had pine, caramel and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, grass, caramel, biscuits and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty, hoppy and bitter. A nice hoppy and malty brew. Not too extreme.
A small taste from a friend (tap) @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear amber with a medium head. Aroma is malts with tropical fruits and pine. Flavor is creamy malts, tropical fruits, pine and hops. Great.
Keg @ Brewdog Birmingham. Pours hazy orangey amber, frothy off-white head. Caramel, orange, pine, floral, not massively hoppy, a good bittersweet character, orange syrup finish. Decent.
De barril en la cerveceria Ipa de Gijon, aromatica y muy sabrosa. Buen cuerpo

Lata del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 13/12/2015
BBD: 08/16 Color ambar, sabor caramelo frutal, cuerpo medio, final amargo, buena.
Can, Brewdog Leicester. Golden amber with an off white foam. Toffee with earthy pine leafiness and tropical fruit. Oranges with spices. Very drinkable.

Tap at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, caramel, resiny element, some hops and malts. Probably this beer has seen more fresh days.

Can at BD CJ. It pours clear amber with a thick off-white head. The nose is bitter-sweet, so very juicy, dank, pine, stewed orange, mango, tangerine, candied peel and pineapple. The taste is crisp, clean, bitter, pineapple needles, resinous, sticky dankness, peppery spice, woody and grapefruit with a lingering dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Well-rounded and pretty tasty. Great stuff.

COD 11/3/15. Clear medium amber pour with a slight garnet tint. Outstanding head volume, world class lacing and retention.

Rich world class nose of dank and sweet tropical (pineapple) hops coupled with a bit of pine and spicy spruce over toasted biscuit plus a caramel note. As it warms orange rind is noted.

Solid medium body that has creamy aspects and a bit of resinous oily slickness. Nearly world class carbonation with a strong effervescent middle and a prickly burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is outstanding and strikes a good balance between hop flavor and bitterness. It begins with a semi-sweet tropical influence that flows to dank in the middle, then pine/spruce towards the finish. Underneath is a toasted biscuit that flows to caramel as the finish approaches and delivers the strongest sweet note - noticeable, but not dominant. The middle delivers a very balanced moderate bitterness that is spruce/pine that shifts to rind in the finish that lingers.

Dark coppery color with an off-white head with short to medium duration, good laework. Aroma has notes of toasted mats, some flowery hops, light orange and peach. Flavor has a mild bitterness with medium maltiness, notes of orange, some grapefruit and peach. MIld bitterness in the final with good duration.

Color marrón claro, espuma esponjosa de retención media.
En nariz cítricos y pino, con incluso un pequeño toque ahumado.
Cuerpo medio, resinosa y carbonatación media.
En boca muy sabrosa. Pomelo, pino y caramelo. Amarga pero bastante equilibrada con una buena carga maltosa. 
Muchos matices, regusto amargo prolongado. Un cervezón!
Light brown colour. Aroma is very piney and fruity. Extremely flavoursome. Smooth malty feel. Nice bittersweet hop balance.
UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 Very good balance to this beer, dank mouldy basement (in a good way, trust me) resin and fruit aroma, just the right bitterness and mellow maltiness. A long dry aftertaste
Can @ BrewDog Doghouse. Amber brown, good head. Leafy pine hop aroma. Leafy caramel hop flavour. sharp with bitter hoppy aftertaste. Hoppy Amber ale.
Can from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Nice rosy golden colour with a healthy white head. Aroma is dry and hoppy, a bit reedy too. Taste is ry and bitter. Prickly and medium. OK beer.

Pours a slightly hazy, pale golden orange color with apricot colored edges and a two finger pillowy white head that very slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Very good retention with streaks of soapy lacing coating the glass on the way down.

Floral, slightly spicy aroma with grassy hops, pale malt, subtle caramel and tropical fruit sweetness. Fresh cut grass and resinous oils along with grapefruit and orange peel countered by bread, biscuit, caramel and toffee. Nice balance of fruit, malt and delicate grassy hops.

Medium body with a crisp, spicy hop bite up front that lingers over the sweeter notes and malt backbone into a slightly dry finish. Grassy and slightly herbal with pine needle and dank earthy hop oils countered by ruby red grapefruit, mango and orange peel. Caramel malt backbone with toffee, caramel, bread and dark fruit. This is a pretty nice beer thats well balanced and surprisingly sessionable at 6.8%.

Pours hazy amber with low white head
Aromas of tropical fruits, malty bread, caramel, 
Taste is hoppy of citrus, tropical fruits, pine, resin, caramel, bread
Malty body, nice hoppyness, medium carbonated

Tap @ Monks American Bar, Stockholm. Almost clear amber, average white head, good lacing. Floral hoppy aroma, biscuits and grass. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, average carbonated. Hoppy taste, mango, citrus zest, biscuits and caramel.

22nd November 2015Can. Clear amber beer, big cream colour head. Palate is light and mildly dry, decent fine carbonation. Smooth malts bring a light creamy sweetness. Hops are orange and a little marmalade. Pine kicks in and dominates, sweet and spicy pine. Trace of floral peach. Hop spice starts to bloom. Mild skunk and then light tangerine and tropical fruits. Light finish. A wide range of hop flavours here. Fruity and spicy. Very nice. Tastes like an IPA though.
Can in Brewdog Newcastle. Golden with a frothy off white head. Hoppy pine aroma. The taste is big and full of resinous pine. Dank. Some underlying caramel. My type of IPA. Excellent.

Aroma: Dank Heated Jungle Pine

Appearance: Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Thick White Head, Sticky Lacing

Taste: Dank, Piney, Mildly Floral

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mild Filling, Mildly Drying
Can from Biercab Shop. Amber colour with white head. Resinous and fruity aroma. Sweet, caramel, resinous, fruity, bitter, citric taste. Medium body.
Pint can. Hazy dirty orange pour with a small white head. Still a carmely amber ale, but with some assertive hopping with the good stuff. Pretty solid.

Cobrizo limpio y espuma color crema ligera. Aromas de menta, pino, fruta naranja, malta caramelo de fondo. Cuerpo medio, sabor inteso de hierba fresca, pino, golpe cítrico y final de amargor duradero ligeramente resinoso.

Can from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Clear golden body with a thick white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of caramel, candy and a hint of mango. Flavour of stewed tea, blood orange and bitter hops with a peppery, menthol quality on the finish. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Its quite pale, but this is nice and hoppy Amber Ale.
Can - It is dark but not really amber. Nice head with good lacing on the glass. Lots of hops and a dry grass taste. Medium body and dry.

Pours cloudy copper with two fingers of white head. Aroma of resin, toffee, grapefruit and blood orange. Taste is rich resin bitter with light balancing malt sweetness before a bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Lightly coloured amber beer with a reasonable head. The aroma is fruity and dry, and the flavour is bitter with plenty of hops and dryness. Overall a nice dry and hopped beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from Brewdog Birmingham; clear amber pour with a frothy white head, aroma has big pine and caramel, taste has resinous pine, a hint of mango, sweet caramel, nice dank action.
50 cl can @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are peach, grapefruit, pine, and malt - with a bitter finish.
Pours Amber , with a thick white head. The canning has kept the hop profile high, with a great bitter finish, while the malt gives a solid background .

Canned. Pours slightly hazy amber with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus, lime zest, apricot, piney notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice hoppy Amber. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Amber colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, some bready and crystal malty notes. Flavour is crisp maltiness with some wood, floral and fruity notes along with some herbal notes in the finish. The crystal malts works surprisingly well in this beer and its crispiness.
Amber pour. Pretty clear. Off white head. Pretty carbonated. Medium malts some hops. Overall good beer.
Can, thanks Roberto. Dirty Amber brown. Hoppy, dank, citrus, and toffee in the aroma. Flavor is similar, toast, herb, citrus and grass. Medium sticky body.
Can at NK Bar. Amber color, small off-white steady head. Caramel, rye in the nose. Medium-bodied. Rye, caramel, resin and menthol. Spicey hoppyness in the aftertaste. Feels slightly old.
Can @ nk bar. Pours deep amber with a thin off white head. Caramel, hay, resin, pine in aroma. Flavor has pine, grapefruit, oranges, resin. Strongly hopped, balancing sweetness.

On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Hazy amber. Citrussy caramel nose. Nice bitterness, citrus and caramel complementing each other. Refreshing.

On tap not sure exactly on the style based on description but it is a lightly hopped ipa that uses all the right hops just not over the top. Nice fruity aroma and up front hops dance and are fairly bitter but quickly fade. Really nice first beer i have had from them.
Im not crazy about amber ales that are this hoppy, but it smells pretty damn good and its not aggressively sweet so I like it overall.

On tap at Bishops Arms Vasagatan. 

Golden/amber with a white head. Aroma of hops and caramel. Similar taste although not as hoppy as the aroma. Medium bitter and with a medium mouthfeel.
@ Bishops Vasa 15-9-12: en ganska enkel och ordinär öl som kanske är aningen obalanserad. Fruktig men ganska bitter.

A golden ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, nice caramel malt with grassy floral hops, resinous character, light treacle, grainy, nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity caramel malt with grassy floral hops, resinous character, pink grapefruit pulp, nice and smooth. On tap at brewery.
Can at Bishops Arms in Örebro. Flowery smell with caramel. Light hoppy taste with grapefruit. Medium bitterness. Better taste then smell.

An interesting hybrid of IPA and amber. Pours a rich amber color, very aromatic but not your usual punch of citrus or cascade, a little more nuanced and unique in that special Modern Times way. Another favorite from Modern Times.
Burk Bishops örebro. Mörkorange kulör med beiget skum. Humlig doft av barr och russin. Smaken är aningen söt med knäck, torkad frukt och citrus.
More pale ale then Amber. Pours a clear orange. Smells of hops and tropical fruit. Taste is basic pale, more tropical fruit and a semi-bitter finish. Had on tap at Bay Area Brew Fest 2015.

Draught @ Churchills Pub & Grille, San Marcos, CA 

Pours reddish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of citrus, juicy fruits, pine, resin and caramel. Taste is hoppy, resinous and caramel with some pine and juicy fruits. Finish is hoppy, caramely and sweetish with some resin and juicy fruits. Tasty.

Draught @ Churchills Pub & Grille, San Marcos, CA. Pours a golden copper colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of biscuit, floral hops and grapefruit. Flavour of crisp citrusy bitterness, dank hops, citrus and biscuit. A bit of sweetness. Medium bodied. Nice and crisp.

Tap @ Churchills Pub & Grille, San Marcos.
Pours clear golden with a small head. Hops on the aroma, resin, oranges and pale malts with some pine on the finish. Resinous hop flavor, toffee and sweet citric fruits. Good. 
3515

Draught @ Churchills Pub & Grille, San marcos. Aroma has resin and pineapple juice. Flavour has resin, grapefruit, tropical fruits and mild mineral tones. Clean and solid but perhaps a bit straightforward.

Keg at 3små rum cons 2015-08-27 Göteborg
AR: dried bread, dried fruity
AP: clear bronz, wee stouthy snow white head
F: butter, bitter, citrus,
Can shared with friends. Not much going on in the aroma, but the flavor was nice. Some malty notes with a refreshing bitterness.
Canned, Nice balance of hoppy and malty. I get mixed tropical fruits set in a toffee malt base. Long dry finish. Very tasty stuff. Paired well with a big mac.

October 25th, 2013 - A hoppy amber! Count me in. Ambers often need a little pizazz, and an extra handful of hops might do the trick. The aroma is predominantly hoppy as I had hoped, with a heavy dank weed type scent, but at the same time sweet and redolent of pine trees and their needles. The palate is nice and rich, covering and coating the tongue as it goes, expressing a healthy flavor and poised balance. Deep, hoppy and engaging, the Hoppy Amber might be my favorite "non-dark" brew from this brewery to date.

On tap at OConnors. Golden amber with no head. Completely flat. Aroma fruity, hoppy, soap, caramel and light chlorine. Taste is soapy, hoppy, caramel sweetness, grapefruit, slight wood with a sweet and hoppy finish

16oz can pours clear rust orange with 2 finger head. Nose is sticky mango, orange, melon, light malt fruit. Taste has nice resiny orange piney mango, round melon, cantaloupe, medium bitterness. Finish has lingering resiny bitterness, melon rind, touch of malt toast, round orange, light caramel and a hint of wildflower honey. Good stuff.
Pours Amber orange with a small head. The aroma has caramel, malt, peachy and pine hop notes. The flavour is smooth with caramel, grapefruit and pine hops, and a lightly sugary impression. Nice.
Pours semi clear amber with a medium frothy off white head. Aromas of caramel, citrus, peach, apricot, resin. Taste is apricot, peach, caramel, slght toffee, pine, resn.
Amber with a white head. Sweet malty with a large dose of citrus and floral hops. The sweetness is well balanced by the hops. Good.
Can, pours a copper color with small head. Smells of hops and caramel with some citrus. The taste is more malt with some nice hops. A very nice amber ale and one of the best I have had.

Pale burnt golden, soft ringed white cap. Peppery, piney.nose. Slightly cheesy, brassy bitterness. Solid carbonation, a lot paler malt than would be expected. Gummy grabs of citrus, finishes long and ripe. Can, Beers I Hadnt Known Were Gushers Daisy Tasting
Can thanks to Mike. Amber with white head. Aroma of hops, resinous, pine, some grapefruit and mango. Taste is resinous, piney, some caramel, mango. Slightly sweet and bitter.
Pours a bronze shade of yellow. Aroma is slight caramel and a hint if fruits. Taste is grspefruit, lychee, mango, mild bitter with a slight sweet finish.
Can at craigs. Pours clear amber, nose is herbal, pine, toffee, taste is sweet, fruity, dry.
bottle at home ... golden ... big tan head ... soft soft orange fruit ... soft floral fruit nose ... soft fruits ... light bitter fruit .. light herbal fruit .. bitter orange peel .. zezty hop

Bottle at Craig?s. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of resinous hops, light citrus, light pine. Taste is bitter, light caramel. Thin finish. 
12th July, gusher tasting
Can. Rich amber beer with a cream head. Light grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and pine flavor with light malt. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and light pine linger with light malt and light tropical fruit.

A dank hop aroma? I am intrigued. Anyway, dusky orange colour with a cream coloured head that didnt hang around. Some haze to the body but immediately forgiven because of the dessert fruit and caramel aromas. Some spruce and resin that comes through more strongly in the flavour. Theres tangy tangerine on the bitterness profile and a lengthy finish as there is plenty of hoppy loveliness to carry the flavour along. 
Bliss.

Really strong dank aroma with this one, pours a clear dark amber with a thin white head. Lots of fruit hop notes in this one, very little caramel at all. Just a touch of sweetness that then fades out to citrus and a lingering bitter finish. If you like your beers hoppy, this is one to try.
Kräftig goldene Farbe, ordentlich weißer Schaum. Geruch sehr malzig, sehr grasig, nass hopfig. Geschmack sehr grasig hopfig, nass hopfig, würzig, trocken im Abgang.

16 Oz can poured and shared by Keven. Thanks! Pours a clear golden color with a huge foamy head and lace. Huge hop forward aroma. Not very amber like in my opinion. Drinks like an imperial IPA. Thick, creamy body with an obvious sweetness. Has a toasty malt finish. On the dry side towards the finish. Tastes sweet, but not really a sugary sweet. Interesting beer for sure, and very well done. Good beer here.

Pours amber red with an off white head. The aroma holds strawberry jam, tropical fruits, sweet bready malt with a balanced whisper of caramel. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and a tiny, clean acidic touch. Sweet red berries, tropical fruits and a perfect malt profile for the style. The mouthfeel is clean and soft with a medium carbonation. Ear medium bodied.

Lukt: Frukter, citrus og en anelse krydder.
Utseende: Dunkel gulbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt Skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Frukter, Citrus med en noe bitter avslutning.
