Tap at Lomaland. Pours clear dark orange to amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is dank, passion fruit, citrus, and melon hops, and light cracker malt. Flavor is moderate citrus, tropical fruit, and dank hops, moderate bitterness, light cracker malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Can at Evernote. Big aromas and rich flavors of tropical hops, pineapple, fruity malts. Bright, resiny, rich, well-balanced and extremely drinkable.

My Bottom Line:
Lemongrass and citrus fruit flavors ride subtle cereals to an elegant resinous hop finish, building yet another beautiful Modern Times quencher.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A healthy head of foam covers the golden-hued amber.
-The amber color strangely translates to only very light toasted and caramel malt flavors.
-This would be wonderful on the hand pull.
-The flavor profile is balanced.

On tap at the brewery tasting room.

Draught @ 3 Små Rum. Pours pale amberish golden with a small offwhite head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty, tiny floral, earthy and herbal with caramel, bread, grapefruit, moist grass, moist soil, lemon balm, alcohol and lemon peal. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, tiny malty and herbal. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and bitter with caramel, bread, grapefruit, moist grass, moist soil, pine needles and lemon peal. Solid Amber but it shows its taken some time to travel here.

Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a dark golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy finish.
Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear amber, medium white head. bready, bisuity malt, piney, perfumy, dank hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium to high bitterness.
On tap at City beer. Pours dark copper with white head. Big hip aroma. Taste is malty with a nice hot bitterness.

Pours murky red brown with thin lasting head. Great fruit and dank aroma as described. Taste is wet hop forward with a nice malt balance. Minimal bitterness. Very well done

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours amber with a thick white head. Aroma of bitter citrus and pine with a hint of caramel malt. Taste is bitter citrus and pine with a solid malt backbone. Nice hoppy amber.

Can. Crimson-orange with moderate haze. A dense inch of froth recedes slowly. Juicy aroma: grass, juicyfruit, white grapes, mango, grapefruit peel. Theres a solid malty backbone, but this is primarily hop-focused. The flavor gets more resinous, with grass, citrus peel, mango and papaya. Mostly grass. Caramel, burnt sugar and biscuits provide a sweet backbone. Medium-bodied with vibrant carbonation. Sticky hop oils coat the tongue and linger. Modern Times has a winner here. I grab a pack every time I go to San Diego.

Tallboy from foodshow in shibuya. Drank straight from the can. Big dank hop aroma wit fruity and resiny notes both present. Sweet and bitter on the palate. Malt backbone is super solid. Hops leave a really nice bitterness that lingers. Awesome Amber for hop heads.

Canned 16 oz. Cool hoppy take on the amber style; color is light copper poured into a pint glass with low-medium carbonation and quick fading head. Aroma is full of white peach, apricot, grapefruit. Flavor is simple and clean, with Nelson stealing the show. Earthy bitterness that stacks up incrementally on the back of the flavor profile. Really clean and sessionable overall. Palate leans a bit thin with the carbonation/head. I could crush four or five of these on a hot August afternoon at the beach. I'm a fan.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep amber colour with a frothy off white head. Aroma is of caramel malts and citrus scents; nicely balanced. Taste is moderately sweet and not really bitter. Medium body, smooth and slightly creamy on the palate with lively carbonation. Overall a really nice Amber ale.
Draught at Burgermania. Excellent stuff, lots of red and dry fruit flavors with a rich caramel malt backbone. One more please!

Really nice amber ale! Fantastic juicy and fruity aroma and well balanced!
From a can.

Draft at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a fizzy white head. Tastes like tropical fruit, hop resin, caramel, grapefruit hops, and nutty malt. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like hop resin, caramel, grapefruit, and dry citrus hops.

[2/21/15] Draught at Modern Times Flavordome in San Diego. Clear deep golden. Nice hoppy aroma with tropical fruits. Great sweetish flavor with nice juicy fruity hoppiness, tropical and citric, with refreshing bitterness. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Tasted from draft. Pours a clear amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet with some fruity notes and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet with a mild bitterness. Lot of tropical fruit flavor with caramel and toffee. A little bit of citrus and floral notes. Overall a very good amber. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Top notch stuff. Being in a can means I can live half way around the world from where it was made and still get the full aroma and flavour. And what an aroma and flavour. Oh boy. Initial hit of aroma was extremely floral - I spose from the mosaic- then orange citrus, a touch of pine(but only a touch), then as it warmed slightly a sweet cured meat - maybe pork loin - but underwritten by a really boss platform of dank. Believe the hype. The only problem I have with this beer is that, if you present me with such good flavours, I want you to take your gloves off and jolly well hammer them mercilessly into my tongue and cheeks, but I feel that this beer takes it a bit to nice and politely in that regard. But really Im just being picky.

Draft sample at Hunahpu day 2015. A hopped up Amber ale. Two of my favorite things. Dank, pine, caramel malts. Great stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is a amber with a average white head. Aroma a nice dank hop with some caramel malt sweetness. Flavor is much of the same. Hops to start then a bit of caramel malt and finishes with a earthy grain. This is a well done amber ale. This is how you elevate a kinda boring style. Just hop the hell out of it.
Great amber with tons of citrus hop and light caramel malts and tasty fruity hops. This is highly drinkable and great.

Pours gold not much Amber to it with lots of head and tons of lacing. Nose. Is grassy and some fruit. Flavours are fruit, some peach and some syrup, some grapefruit. Taste med bitter and light sweet. Fullish body with lively carbonation.
(Tap) clear bright Amber colour with a small beige head; rich balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish
draft, nice sweet and caramel moderate base malt. Tons of hops balanced bitter flavors and finish Great execution.

Tap at brewery. Pours clear golden amber with creamy white head. Aroma is dank and grassy hops, light floral notes, some cereal malts, and faint caramel. Flavor is hop forward with good citrus and grassy notes atop a dry malt base with some subtle caramel sweetness buried underneath. Medium body and carbonation.

16 oz can in trade from Phesterjau. Looks like amber, Smells HOPS, minimal caramel but its there, and later a hint of plastic. Tastes alright with a bit for malt balance, also a big hop flavor and bitterness. Good carb and bitterness but there is a bit of a that plastic flavor and texture. I have gotten that taste several times from commercial and my own homebrew. Pretty good beer besides that little flaw.
Can at Dangerous Bottle Share 6.0. Light amber pour with a decent head. Dank, grassy, green apples, lots of floral notes, vanilla and some grapefruit.

Can thanks to Bursprak! Pours a semi clear, dark amber with a smal,, white, fairly dense head. Aroma is crazy fresh fruity, hoppy, pear, peach, sharp freshness! This is a bitter beer with lots of fresh, fruity and crisp hops! Some sweeter fruits and slight malt sweetness as well. Really really nice and refreshing!

16oz can into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours copper orange in color. Mostly transparent. Decent white head. 

Aroma is great. Very tropical - mango, passion fruit, some citrus. Malty backbone. 

Taste is slightly sweet upfront, then bitter in the finish. 

Medium-full body, soft carbonation. Long finish. 

Really pretty nice.

Can thanks to bursprak. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma is DANK with lots of tropical notes like mango, mandarin, tangerine and sweet orange. Also some fresh herbs and a weak amount of malt sweetness behind. The taste is bitter and tropical but with a fair amount of sweetness as well which makes this beer very drinkable. Crispy notes of tropical hops, weak pine and some fresh herbs along with a tiny malt sweetness. This is a beer that I really enjoy! Juicy and da-da-da-dank!

Can thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy dark orange with almost no head. Aromas of hops, fresh citrus, orange peel, some skunky notes, "dank". Taste is more malty sweet, hops, citrus, pretty dank, skunky, ripe orange, good bitterness and a nice full body.

Poured a clear amber brown color with aromas of hops, pone, light citrus and a touch of caramel. Flavors are the same as aromas a nice hop flavor with citrus and pine. Would almost classify this as an ipa but subtle bread and caramel come through on the palate. Very nice beer could drink this a ton.

Courtesy of leaf_hound
Can: The aroma consists of moderate citrus, tropical fruits, dank hops, light lemon, and a touch of caramel. It pours a transparent amber with a one finger off-white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thick ring. There is some very thin webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate citrus, tropical fruits, and mango. There are some faint caramel notes in the background. The finish has moderate dank hops, grass, light grapefruit, and lemon peel. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, definitely more like an IPA or heavily hopped Pale Ale than an Amber...and thats always a good thing in my book.
Draft at the brewery. Been a while since I had this one. Excellent for the style. Big dank hops and amber malts. Chocolate and caramel hiding under the hops. Sticky and tasty.

4cl sample at Mikkeller Bangkok beer week.
thin white head. Hazy pale amber pour. Lovely hop bitterness. Enjoyable

Can at Harney Sushi, Oceanside, California. Pour is a beautiful amber with a white head that has fantastic lacing. Aroma is super dank. Reminds me of Stones Enjoy By 4.20.14. Super pungent, lots of citrus, but a sweet underlying caramel sweetness is throughout the aroma and taste. Oniony, garlicy dankness. Me likey.
Tap @ Library Alehouse: super hoppy for an amber ale. Robust with citrusy pine flavors. Pretty much an IPA

Sample at the Aces & Ales Winter Beer Fest on 01/17/2015. The beer is a clear copper-golden color with a medium off-white head that dissipates steadily to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Tropical fruit, herbal hops and malt in the nose. Medium-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, passion fruit and biscuit malt. The finish is fruity with a citrus and hops aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

16 oz. can courtesy of a trade with paiste2002. Pours a lightly hazed golden amber with a moderate off-white head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left light lace. Very pleasant aroma that is dominated by sweet fruity orange, pineapple, and grapefruit. The flavor begins with a solid malt base with some light sweetness, and follows with fruity orange, pineapple and grapefruit. Mild-moderate bitterness at the finish. Medium bodied. Very good!
Un nez d:agrumes, de raisins verts, pêches pas envore mûres et résine de pin. Le liquide est assez filiforme et collant avec finition sèche et chaude.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Big pine aroma in an amber pour.  Big flavor has the hops and malt in balance but overall I think their Oneida is a better beer (albeit maybe mainly because it is more sessionable).

Location/Date:Can in December 2014.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy red orange.
Aroma: Aroma of pine and caramel.
Taste: Light medium bitterness, caramel, grapefruit.
Palate:Light medium body, lightly sticky.
Summary: Second beer from Modern Times I have really enjoyed out of two. Nice amount of bitterness for an amber ale.

Pour is dark copper, clear, white head, large bubbles and lacing. Nose is riddled with sweet malts, toasted grains, candied hops, faint citrus. Flavor is thin, very malty, lots of toasted caramel, bitter grassy hops, faint citrus. Medium body, lighter carb,

Can shared in NYC. Pours clear, deep gold with a creamy white head. Great aroma, lots of dank hops, flowery hops, ripe fruits. Medium sweet flavor with oily hop character, pine, melon, papaya. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Oily and resinous on the finish, with pine, mild bready malts, gooey tropical fruits. Very solid.
Pours a clear light Amber, white head. Aroma mega fruity dank hop, heavy Nelson, grass, tropical fruits. Flavor is gooey hops and fruits. This shit is TAF (tasty as fuck)

Can - Pours copper with a filmy off white head. Nose is dank and oniony with mango and sweet bready malt. Taste is super hoppy, with dank onion and tropical fruit. Dry bready malt with a bitter astringent hoppiness. Slick and medium-bodied with mellow carbonation.
From tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Recommended by bar staff. Citrus and passion fruit on the nose. Very hoppy. Almost like a DIPA. Well balanced. A great beer altogether.

I poured this into a pokal from a pint can and considered how terribly light-bodied it seemed. Obviously a bit of a paradox! The liquid is ruby-amber and crystal clear, capped with a white sea-foam; rocky and soft, all at once. The lacing is light on the glass, delicate and sticky.

Grapefruit and passion fruit take the point, but the aroma is outrageously dank with hops; it comes across more of a DIPA than an Amber, but with a caramel malt rich enough to temper the idea. Still, if I was nose first into a hops cone, I couldnt get too much more resin than Im finding here. (sigh-love)

The body median, this brew still flows nicely, balanced and flavorful. The carbonation "fair to middlin" is popping lightly over my tongue and cheeks, adding to the dryness that keeps me tipping the glass. The finish is short, slightly bitter and very, very comfortable. 

A friend told me that this beer would "surprise me...in a great way." It has!

Hand dlivered by Maxbier all the way from L.A. Thanks Maxbier, this is a great brew! Pours clear copper with off white head. Aroma is citrus, pineapple, and papaya. Flavor starts big tangerine and clementine, followed with sweet pineapple, ripe sweet mango, and Papya. Finishes with a resiny pine. Slight bitterness in finish but does not linger. Really nice, sweet, fruity brew. Really liking these hopped up ambers.

Keg at the Flavordome, North Park SD, 15/11/14.
Clear golden with a moderate white covering.
Nose is citric peel, hops, orange pith, pine.
Taste comprises pine needle, juicy satsuma, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid hoppy amber.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, skunky malt, citrus hop. The flavour is moderate to strong bitter with a yeast, super strong hop bitter, light toothpaste palate and a forever lingering bitter finish. There are clearly lots of hops in here and it surprised me that the aroma was as light as it was.
One of my all time favorite IPAs. Citrusy, sweet, fruity aroma. Taste is very similar with the perfect amount of hoppy bitterness. Highly recommend

On tap at Stone Escondido. Pours an Amber gold with a thin off white head. Aroma seems off cardboard. Overall fine. But didn't rally like this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught US pint at Smith Street Taps in Singapore. Sweet aroma of citrus, pine and hops. Dark amber colour, clear and with a small head. Medium carbonation. Heavily hopped, citrus and malt taste, with grapefruit dominant. A nice unique amber ale.

Amber color with a white head. Aroma is sweet and citrus with a slight fruitiness. A dominant sweet taste but with a nice hoppy balance. Definitely a great one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a fabulous IPA. Cant get enough of it. A new favorite of mine!

16 ounce can from Timfoolery, dark amber, bitter with a citrus hint. Thin disappearing head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Hazy light amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of pineapple, mango, citrus, blackberries, light toast and grain
Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of pine, light toffee and mango. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty good.

on cask at cask days 2014. orange with a white head. quite clear and nicely carbed. good cask. hops saturation is unreal. lotsa hop aroma, flavour and bitterness. quite the hop experience. nice sipper.

Modern times 
Blazing world
American amber ale
6.8% ABV
85 IBU

APPEARANCE: Poured a hazy, ugly, penny copper orange with a lazy sticky two finger off white head. Stuck around for a nice while before finally settling into a small halo. 

AROMA: If dank was a fruit, then this would be fresh squeezed dank! Great tropical fruit overload, pineapple, mango, and citrus. The simcoe hops really hit the nose before making way for the malty goodness that crashes over. 

TASTE: The aroma makes you think you are drinking an ipa, but the first sip is malt forward and reminds you that this is still an amber ale. Flavor is intense and in your face. Great fruitiness and floral notes that are interviewed with a small amount of pine. Finishes out with a nice sweet biscuity, honey backbone. 

MOUTHFEEL: Medium body and Medium carbonation. Slightly more sticky and chewy then I would expect from 6.8% ABV. Nice semi dry snappy finish that quenches me thirst but also leave me longing for a other sip at the same time. 

OVERALL: I'll go right out and say this is my favorite amber to date. So well balanced, but the hoppiness that isn't usually found in an amber is nice and present. Makes it drink like an American amber ipa combo and I love it! Great job Modern Times, I now put this above the fortunate islands on my top Modern Times beer list!

Got in a trade with BeerBaron666. 16 ounce can into tulip glass; no canning date, but should be pretty fresh. Pours lightly hazy deep orange amber color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big mango, passion fruit, pineapple, tangerine, lemon zest, orange rind, floral, grass, light pine, biscuit, caramel, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity of dank citrus/tropical hops with moderate malt balance; and good strength. Taste of big mango, passion fruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange rind, caramel, biscuit, floral, grass, light pine, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fair amount floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of mango, pineapple, tangerine, lemon/orange zest, floral, grass, caramel, biscuit, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity of bright citrus/tropical hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome hoppy amber ale. All around great complexity and balance of citrus/tropical hops and bready malt flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Can: pours the color of a copper pipe ready to sweat, some lazy bubbles spring to the top but no real head ever builds (would appear to be under-carbonated, but the can gave a big hiss upon opening). Aroma... wow, sticky icky dank-ass hops & sweet caramel candies up in this bitch. Wet, dank hop oils cover a grassy field of passion fruit, guava, grapefruit, & pineapple while the sky is raining toffee & caramel Bullzeye candy. The taste is a bit more malt forward with a large, sweet caramel & nutty presence... But theres still plenty of hoppage to make its way around. Tangerine, mango, passion fruit, grass, skunky musky hops. Definitely wasnt expecting this at all... What I thought would be a boring amber turned out to be a sticky dank bomb with a largely sweet, yet balanced malt underbody. Possibly the best amber Ive had - blows Nugget Nectar out.

text: On tap at Urge. Pours a clear amber with a one finger off white head which fades to very little lacing . Aroma is piney hops, citrus, dank weed, and light sweet malts.
